items.name: <:seeker:648821145050808320> ***Seeker - Unidentified Contact*** ___0.51rc2___ <:seeker:648821145050808320>
items.description:
<:seeker:648821145050808320> ***Seeker - Unidentified Contact*** ___0.51rc2___ <:seeker:648821145050808320> 

_ Venturing in the dark outreaches of the Persean Sector is a pathway to salvaging ships with many abilities, some considered to be unnatural._

```[RC2] Fixed most (all?) crashes related to the "Lucky Strike" Nexerelin start.
 - Added 6 new special bounties that point towards exploration-based content (if you have yet to find it after a certain amount of time).
 - Added 2 new Nexerelin custom starts to twist the formula a bit.
 - 557-class: Fixed system not applying the main gun extra ammo properly.
 - Improved armor grid of the Halligan and the other gunships. They are now also displayed "naked" in refit.
 - All the rare-but-not-unique bounties now have much spicier loadouts.
 - All bounty captains now have better suited skills.
 - Many ship descriptions got a much needed polish pass.
 - Made all the plague-bearer encounters approximatively 267% audio-visually more impressive.```

**Download:** <https://www.patreon.com/posts/61242196>

**Forum:** <http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=19414.0>
**Nexus:** <https://www.nexusmods.com/starsector/mods/50?tab=files>
**MagicLab discord:** <https://discord.gg/tK3JWBbQ>
**Bug report/feedback:** <https://forms.gle/YbQ8cYUA5QaJBCYV8>

items.name: A small mod regarding lobster proliferation
Advanced Gunnery Control 0.11.0 ("stable")/0.12.0(pre-release)
items.description:
Advanced Gunnery Control 0.11.0 ("stable")/0.12.0(pre-release)
Forum Thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21280.0
Download: https://github.com/DesperatePeter/starsector-advanced-weapon-control/releases

This mod gives you more control over the way weapon groups behave when on autofire. For each weapon group, you can select a fire mode (e.g. AvoidShields) and a suffix (e.g. HoldFire when Flux > 75%) to customise how that group should behave. Also features basic ship modes (e.g. LowerShields when Flux > 50%) and a ~~badly~~ expertly done GUI.
Can be added/removed to/from an ongoing campaign.

Relevant new features in 0.11.0: Lots of bugfixes for the custom targeting AI, rework of target/avoidShields modes (now consider shield flanking)

New features in 0.12.0: GUI polish, ability to load suggested weapon modes. 
Note for faction/content extension mod authors: You can now add suggested modes/suffixes for your weapons in modSettings.json (refer to https://github.com/DesperatePeter/starsector-advanced-weapon-control/blob/devel2/data/config/modSettings.json for an example)

Feedback is much appreciated, especially on the pre-release version.
Thanks and happy gaming/modding!

items.name: ArmaA Robotics v2.0**
items.description:
**ArmaA Robotics v2.0** 
**Requires MagicLib + LazyLib**
**NOT SAVE COMPATIBLE W/ PREVVERSIONS**
**HOTFIX: fix 4 mag submod**
**HOTFIX 2 + 3: Fix CTD from hovering over wingcom / silversword**
see forum for full info
```
V2.0
--------------------
- New Ship, Valkazard
- New Ship, Broadsword(AA)
- New Ship, Warthog(AA)
- New Ship, Kouto E-Type
- New fighter, Valken(P)
- New Fighter, Prodromos Battle Armor
- WINGCOM SUITE:
    - Can now be used on standard carriers
        - Max stat bonus conferred by relationship reduced to 30% (was 75% for defensive and 37% for offensive)
    - Added fluff text for characters with 'villain' voice
    - Added fluff text for characters with 'soldier' voice
        -wingmen will appear in battle as a pilot of their respective fighter
        - can also gain new skills over time and level up
        - Implemented GUI for changing squad name/callsigns/portraits.
-Laser Blade(s)
    - Increased on-hit knockback.
- Will now launch from valid carriers (if any) on deployment instead of burn in
- fixed bug where player was not properly referred to using gender appropriate title(based on portrait) when landing
- Carriers can only supply as many Strikecraft as the number of fighter bays they possess (I.E. a Condor can resupply only two strikecraft at once, as opposed to an unlimited number)
- Doubled carrier replacement rate decrease while rearming.
- added modSettings for custom configuration of refit penalties for (ideally) mod weapons and hullmods, and squadron chatter
- Fixed Strikecraft changing to Frigate HullSize if they took damage that frame
- Should fix inconsistency with some onhit effects that used hullsize, fighter damage bonuses from skills, etc
- Reduced value of Cataphract & Advanced Cataphract BP package
- Removed submarket rep/transponder requirement for gamlin, adjusted stock
```

items.name: HMI Supervillains 0.0.3a: ~~Luddic Experimental~~ Completely Actually Reworked Ed.
items.description:
**HMI Supervillains 0.0.3a: ~~Luddic Experimental~~ Completely Actually Reworked Ed.**

The Draco Group and the Fang Society are two truly deranged factions that inhabit the south-western part of the sector. Both organisations suffer from an obsession with gene-modding to go above conventional humanity in strength, speed, intelligence - and cruelty.

The Draco Group, aristocratic and cold, harvest populations to imbibe their blood in their hedonistic rituals, reaving on high-speed high-tech ships from the system of Prester John. The Fang Society, animalistic and vicious, prey on defenseless peoples to consume, eat and torture, roaming the sector from heavily armoured ships.

While their hatred for the Sector is well know, their loathing for each other is even greater. It is for this reason that their impact on the Sector at large is relatively minor, as they are more content to butcher each other.

*0.0.3 Changes*

-Fang Society now uses ~~the Luddic Experimental~~ a completely new and novel Damper Field system as a replacement for their shield; their hullmods now give less armour and less hull to compensate.
-Draco Group now possesses a passive EMP arc system that zaps nearby enemies, with the zapping rate increasing with rising flux. Shields now take more damage, and the range clamp to 600 units is now more severe to compensate.
-Fang and Draco now have rudimentary Nexerellin starting options

*0.0.3a*
-Fixed the Fang CTD
-Fixed the Draco EMP hitting friendly missiles

*Savegame Compatible*


DOWNLOAD:
https://bitbucket.org/King_Alfonzo/i-will-make-sindria-great-again/downloads/HMI_Supervillains_0_0_3a.zip

items.name: LowTech Armada 0.6.5a (Hotfix)
items.description:
**LowTech Armada 0.6.5a (Hotfix)**

A mostly-hotfix update that fixes the spawn weights of the Hammerhead, E-XXXII 'Havoc' and Brawler Thunderbirds designs.

Adds a large varied variety of ships, weapons and fighters to the Pirates, Derelict and Hegemony.

```
The more-complete Changelog will be posted soon.

However:

(RECENT)

The Hammerhead (TB), E-XXXII 'Havoc', E-XXXII 'Havoc' (TB) and Brawler (TB) should all now properly spawn in pirate fleets.

Some minor writeup and hotfixing for weapon arcs.

The E-XXI 'Jerrycan' now has a (TB) cruiser version that can sometimes rarely replace Ventures in pirate fleets.

(      )

A lot of balance changes have occurred since 0.9.1 Starsector, mainly to Pirate vessels.

There's a fair number of new ships, fighters and weapons since the last major patch (0.5.5).

The Hegemony and Independents will now make use of a new manufacturing line of ships alongside their usual retinue.

The Duinn Thunderbirds (TB) now spawn as rare pirate vessels in fleets (simmilar to how you encounter (XIV) variants for Hegemony ships).

Expect to see new Derelict vessels when exploring.
```

Here's the link to my forum page (Though the previews and gifs are currently out of date): 
https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=13379.0

Here's the mod download link: 

<https://mega.nz/file/h8hUiIDR#Xzmc8BgZE9JRi_MZgAuNrOh8sxJcRM3VAa3cqsoLOSE> 


And here's a gif of the E-XXXII 'Havoc' slapping an unshielded Hound:

https://imgur.com/Xd7cikK

items.name: MOSS (Mod Organizer for StarSector) 0.6.0
items.description:
**MOSS (Mod Organizer for StarSector) 0.6.0**
*Formerly known as Starsector Mod Manager*

**Features:**
- Batch mod installation (no fiddling with nested mods either)
  - Supports all major archive types: zip, tar, rar, 7z
- Version checking out of game
- One click mod updates (aka: mod auto-updates)
- Mod x Starsector compatibility checks
- VMParams editor (Windows only)
- Direct launch (optionally bypassing vanilla launcher)
- Mod search
- Install stats

**Changes:**
- Complete rewrite of application in Druid.
- Feature parity achieved with 0.5.x
- **New**
  - Added new side panel: contains `Tools & Filters` and `Launch`
  - Filters
    - Filters are activated by unchecking a condition in the new `Tools & Filters` pane
    - Conditions include version checker support, update availability, semver difference between local and available version, etc
  - Toggles
    - Toggles are available in the `Tools & Filters` panel
    - Currently only two toggles: `Enable All` and `Disable All`
  - Launch
    - The `Launch` panel contains the previous launch and starsector version widgets
    - It also now contains a widget displaying the selected installation directory and a browse button for faster access.
  - Sort indicators
    - Sorting is now indicated by arrow icons indicating the direction of sorting (ascending/descending)
  - Icons
    - Icons have been utilised throughout the application to improve user experience
  - Dark Theme
    - The default (and only) theming is now dark
    - Light theme is not currently a priority
    - Your retinas can thank me later
  - Installation log
    - Tracks various install events, such as when they start, if they succeed, or error
  - (Dormant) App self updating
    - MOSS (aka: this app) will be able to update itself whenever a new version is release.
    - Only available on Windows and Linux, aka: *not supported on macOS*
- **Fixed**
  - VMParams editing is now only available on Windows
    - It never worked on other platforms *anyway*
    - May be implemented for other platforms in the future

||To download, open the `Download` link, then open the assets folder/accordion/thing and pick your platform||

**Download**: <https://github.com/atlanticaccent/starsector-mod-manager-rust/releases/tag/0.6.0>
**Sources**: <https://github.com/atlanticaccent/starsector-mod-manager-rust>
**Forum**: <https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21995.0>

items.description:
**OOP! ALL VARIANTS (1.1.0) (A Ship/Weapon Pack Submod)**

**1.1.0 Isn't savegame compatible with the 1.0.0 release.**

Falcon (Lion Guard)
Striker (XIV battlegroup)
Liberator (XIV battlegroup)
Vindicator (XIV battlegroup)

All of these ships can be acquired via their faction blueprints, (Falcon via the Lion Guard blueprint, Striker, Liberator, and Vindicator via XIV battlegroup blueprint) or on the open market (hopefully)

```
Version 1.1.0 (23/02/22)
- Added variants to all ships from this mod for the AI to use. Totally didn't just copy the non-Lion Guard or non-XIV variants and tweak it slightly (I totally did, I'm not good at this) Turns out the AI needs these. I definitely totally didn't not know this.

- Added the Striker XIV, Liberator XIVs, Vindicator XIV, and the Falcon Lion Guard ships to their respective faction spawn pools. Turns out they need those. I made them about 50% more rare than their non-specialized counterparts. The only exception is the Lion Guard Falcon, which is about as common as the Lion Guard Eagle from the base SWP mod. Let me know if any ship seems to be spawning too much or too little.

```

**NOTE**
This mod requires Ship/Weapon Pack to work!

items.name: The Holy Covenant of Kemet** *BETA Version 0.0.2e - Fiddling, Flames and ~~F~~Phase Ed.
items.description:
**The Holy Covenant of Kemet** *BETA Version 0.0.2e - Fiddling, Flames and ~~F~~Phase Ed.*

An isolated polity inspired by the ancient Egyptians, the Holy Covenant of Kemet has been forced into Persean Sector politics by Hegemony suspicions of the misuse of artificial intelligence. Utilising advanced (and possibly A.I. influenced) technology, this colourful faction uses unique energy weapons with high strike power, but faulter after prolonged firing.

Version 0.0.2e

-Added the Deshr range of ships; brawler phase ships that regenerate weapon charges faster when in phase, and gets a time boost when emerging from phase.
-Added the Net launcher, a short range Ka weapon that fires HE explosive projectiles.
-Added the Acacia, a cheap Ba weapon that fires guided HE plasma grenade.
-Added the Vine Projector, a cheap, short-ranged Ba fragmentation flamethrower for finishing enemies.

-Fiddled with the stats of the Safflower ships to have better flux and worse armour.
-Khonsur has been reworked a touch to be more combat and less carrier, but still mostly carrier.
-Small ships have been reworked to be better.
-Several weapons have seen minor tweaks.
-Fixed several campaign layer things.
-Added more to ship descriptions.

-Savegame compatible with previous version. 
-**THIS IS A BETA VERSION.** I'm not sure on the balance of the new Deshr ships tbh.

Download here:
https://bitbucket.org/King_Alfonzo/i-will-make-sindria-great-again/downloads/holy_covenant_of_kemet_0_0_2e.zip

Please give me a yell if anything explodes.

items.name: Truly Automated Ships v1.2.1
items.description:
**Truly Automated Ships v1.2.1**

This mod intends to change the way AI officers assigned to automated ships affect the rest of your fleet.

This mod makes it more viable to have powerful automated fleets. It's possible, for example, to have up to three Radiants in your fleet without suffering any CR maluses. The drawback is an increase in the amount monthly supplies required to keep your ships operational. You'll really have to think about how much increasing the power of a given ship is worth to you.

This mod applies a reduction to the "automated ship points" of any ship outfitted with an AI officer, depenging on the type of core.
Having an AI core as an officer also causes a hefty increase to its monthly supply cost, reflecting the huge amount of resources required to run an AI core in the first place.

Please let me know what you think of the numbers. I'm open to tinkering with them to find out which values feel the best to play with.

v1.2.1 changelog
```
- Fixed compatibility issue with Seeker (TAS now only affects ships in the player's fleet)
```

v1.2 changelog:
```
- Updated values and calculations to adapt to patch 0.95.1a-RC6
- Added a modifier to AP reduction based on hull size (sorry, running 12 Radiants per fleet would've been a bit too much)
- Added settings file for customisation
```

Forum page: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21547.0

items.name: Well Advised Modifications
items.description:
**Well Advised Modifications**

Turns Ill Advised Modifications into a harmless flavor mod. ❌ <:notsafe:644276891259240459>  ❌

items.name: Yunru's Midline and Misc Ship hotfixes
items.description:
**__Yunru's Midline and Misc Ship hotfixes__**

> - Made it so that Misc Ships isn't looking for Arsenal's version checker file. (Crashfix)
> - Made it so that Midline actually looks for its version checker file. (Dumbfix)

Find them here:
https://www.patreon.com/posts/60097706

items.name: [0.95.1a] Azur Lane Vanilla Portrait Replacer & Extra Portraits
items.description:
[0.95.1a] Azur Lane Vanilla Portrait Replacer & Extra Portraits

Updated for 0/95/1a, added 2 Luddic portraits, 5 Independent portraits. Replaced luddic_12, portrait43, portrait44, portrait45, and portrait 46.
